utilities

Interface StackADT<E>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MyStack

    public interface StackADT<E>
extends java.io.Serializable
    This is the professional Stack Interface for Advanced Object Oriented Programming (CRPG 311) at the SAIT Polytechnic. This Stack embodies all the standard Stack operations, and includes several helper methods that will give the data structure more flexibility and use. Created On: June 4, 2004 Updated On: Aug. 18, 2009 Updated On: Nov 15, 2018 by kitty

      • push

        void push(E toAdd)
   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Pushes an item onto the top of this stack.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - item to be pushed onto the top of the stack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when attempting to add a null element to the stack.

      • pop

        E pop()
throws java.util.EmptyStackException
        Removes the object at the top of this stack and returns that object as the value of this function.
        Returns:
        the item popped off the top of the stack.
        Throws:
        java.util.EmptyStackException - if there are not items in the stack.

      • peek

        E peek()
throws java.util.EmptyStackException
        Looks at the object at the top of this stack without removing it from the stack.
        Returns:
        the object at the top of this stack.
        Throws:
        java.util.EmptyStackException

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears all the items from this Stack. This method returns, unless there is an Exception (Runtime) thrown.

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this Stack contains no items.
        Returns:
        true if this Stack contains no items.

      • toArray

        Returns an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence. Obeys the general contract of the Collection.toArray method.

      • toArray

        E[] toArray(E[] holder)
     throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence; the runtime type of the returned array is that of the specified array. Obeys the general contract of the Collection.toArray(Object[]) method.
        Returns:
        an array containing the elements of this stack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified array is null.

      • contains

        boolean contains(E toFind)
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns true if this list contains the specified element. More formally, returns true if and only if this list contains at least one element e such that (o==null ? e==null : o.equals(e)).
        Parameters:
        toFind - element whose presence in this list is to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if this list contains the specified element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified element is null and this list does not support null elements.

      • search

        int search(E toFind)
        Returns the 1-based position where an object is on this stack. If the object o occurs as an item in this stack, this method returns the distance from the top of the stack of the occurrence nearest the top of the stack; the topmost item on the stack is considered to be at distance 1. The equals method is used to compare o to the items in this stack.
        Parameters:
        toFind - the desired object.
        Returns:
        the 1-based position from the top of the stack where the object is located; the return value -1 indicates that the object is not on the stack.

      • iterator

        Iterator<E> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the elements in this stack in proper sequence.
        Returns:
        an iterator over the elements in this stack in proper sequence.

      • equals

        boolean equals(StackADT<E> that)
        Used to compare two Stack ADT's. To be equal two stacks must contain equal items appearing in the same order.
        Parameters:
        that - the Stack ADT to be compared to this stack.
        Returns:
        true if the stacks are equal.

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the depth of the current stack as an integer value.
        Returns:
        the current size to the stack as an integer.
